intro: Lithocardium silvestre, commonly known as the wild lithocardium, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils, thriving in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its small white or yellowish flowers bloom in late spring. Lithocardium silvestre is often found in woodland edges and along riverbanks, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
